definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Trend traders use an initial risk rule that determines position size at the time of entry.
sentences.chinese: 趨勢交易者買進伊始，便設立最初的止盈和止損位置。

sentences.english: But then, this is winter and Merriman is as consistent as Old Faithful.
sentences.chinese: 可是，這是冬季買進是一貫的老忠實。

sentences.english: He said would - be buyers have been ' constipated ' with high-priced stocks purchased last year.
sentences.chinese: 他說，潛在的買家尚未消化去年高價買進的大米。
人們總會買進賣出，一直如此。

sentences.english: It established the scope and secured stakeholder buy-in for the entire project.
sentences.chinese: 它爲整個項目確定了範圍和被擔保的項目涉衆買進。

sentences.english: Mr. Cheng, of Ping An, has a 'strong recommendation' on Qingdao Doublestar, listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
sentences.chinese: 平安證券的程磊對青島雙星的評級爲強烈建議買進。

sentences.english: For the investors who had bought the bond, the capital gain would have been quite significant.
sentences.chinese: 那些在價低時買進的投資者，可賺了相當可觀的利潤。

sentences.english: Today, you can get shares of Kraft Foods for $34.
sentences.chinese: 如今，你可以按每股34美元的價格買進卡夫食品。

sentences.english: We usually buy low and sell high.
sentences.chinese: 我們通常低價買進高價賣出。

sentences.english: America made a good bargain in purchasing Alaska.
sentences.chinese: 美國買進阿拉斯加，撿了個大便宜。

sentences.english: Huijin said it would buy more shares over the next 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 中央匯金表示，在未來12個月還將買進更多股票。

sentences.english: The overall technical backdrop however, remains bullish. So, buying on market dips should be rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 不過總體技術面仍看漲，因此逢低買進應是上策。

sentences.english: I am buying the XLF instead.
The more people invest in stocks, the higher the stock prices rise.
sentences.chinese: 買進的人多了，股票行情就看漲。
全球投資者都在買進儲備黃金。

sentences.english: Shopkeepers buy wholesale and sell retail.
sentences.chinese: 小店主整批買進再零售出去。

definition: to sell/to reach (a price in an auction)
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to add up the total/to figure what sth amounts to/to consider
